title: Weets Hill Walking Route

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / From Church Street to Weets Hill, Barnoldswick
images.caption: From Church Street to Weets Hill, Barnoldswick. Barnoldswick's Church Street is a busy street with motor traffic most of the day, but open country is not far away as steep streets climb towards the backdrop of Weets Hill.

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / Horses on rough pasture
images.caption: Horses on rough pasture. This is the field south of Fern Bank Mill where a footpath formerly led to Cow Pasture Farm, one of whose buildings is just visible on the left. In the background is seen Weets Hill.

images.title: Scott Henderson / Trig Point on Weets Hill
images.caption: Trig Point on the hill top. Triangulation pillar at the summit of Weets Hill, near Barnoldswick. Pendle Hill can be seen in the background, to the right of the pillar.

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: View over Barnoldswick to Weets Hill, in Lancashire, England. The short spire of holy Trinity is in the middle of this photograph but the summit of the hill is some 3 km further away. Direction of view south-west.

images.title: Gully on the Flanks of Weet Hill by Chris Heaton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gully on the Flanks of Weet Hill

images.title: Barnoldswick:  Higher Craven View by Dr Neil Clifton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Barnoldswick, Higher Craven View

images.title: Duck Pond Farm with sculpted heads by Dr Neil Clifton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Duck Pond Farm with sculpted heads

images.title: Farm track down to Star Hall by John Topping, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farm track down to Star Hall

description: This circular walk climbs to Weets Hill from Barnoldswick near the edge of the Forest of Bowland AONB. It's a moderate climb, rising to a height of over 1300ft so a good level of fitness is required. The hill is in a great position, close to Pendle, the Forest of Bowland and the Yorkshire Dales. As such the summit makes an excellent vantage point. The walk starts in Wapping on the western side of Barnoldswick where you can pick up the Pendle Way . Follow the waymarked trail south west along Folly Lane and it will take you towards Weets Hill. You can branch off from the lane to climb to the summit which stands at a height of 397 m (1,302 ft). At the peak you will find a Triangulation Pillar and fine views over much of east Lancashire, the north Ribble Valley, north Aire Valley and the Yorkshire Dales. After taking in the views the route descends to Weets House before turning south along the Gisburn Old Road. The route then turns north to follow the Lister Well Road back into Barnoldswick.
